name: Fantasy Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have considered staying here in the past, but was discouraged by the bad reviews. A couple of years ago I asked to see a room and saw their princess suite, but what I was not encouraged. I finally had an opportunity to stay recently when I was looking to spend a romantic night with my wife and the only other rooms available in the city where too expensive standard rooms, or cheap rooms in small hotels with low ratings. For the room features, I felt the rate at Fantasy Inn was worth it. The lobby was much cleaner and neater that it was the previous time I stayed and I was impressed by the appearance of the wedding chappell off the front desk. I asked to see a room and the front desk agent guided us to see a couple of rooms. I was immediately impressed by the cleanliness of the hallways. Both rooms that we got to see were surprisingly clean. We eventually opted to stay in a Royal suite with the heart shaped bath tub and a fireplace. The room features and the cleanliness were the things that stood out and convinced us to stay here since it is so opposite to what I have read in previous reviews. There is no question that the rooms need to be updated and reading the GM's previous responses explaining about an ongoing renovation, I hope it is true. I think the windows should have sheers so that you can have some daylight without compromising privacy, my room did not. There is a huge CRT TV hanging from the ceiling with a sound system connected. I think you can turn it so you can watch tv from the bed or bath tub, but was afraid to try thinking that the tv would crash down. In these days of flat screen TV's, I hope this is one of the things that are changing along with installing a sound system where you can plug in an ipod/ipad/mp3 player; maybe even a DVD player. The two showers were great, but it would be nice with a bigger shower head like some other hotels have. The carpet has seen better days, though it must be difficult to keep clean with a bath tub in the room. The heater was off when we entered the room so it was quite cold and the room took a long time to warm up once we turned the heater on, though together with the fireplace, it eventually got pretty warm. We also had a very good night's sleep on the firm bed. The towels did not seem very old, but were rather rought. I will likely stay here again in future visits and would recommend this for couples, though not for those travelling with kids.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: First I must thank Kathy for giving us the october deal even though our stay was in november. I will continue to stay and send my friends to the fantasy Inn! This stay was just as great as the others. We were excited to see that rennovations have begun in some of the rooms. Our fav room 110 marie antoinette appeared to have fresh paint on the walls and new bed linens and a new coffee maker since we last stayed in march. It was clean and well stocked with paul mitchell ammenities and large white towels, as many as we could ask for. We stayed 3 nights this time and love the large sized rooms that you just can't find elsewhere. This year out of curiosity we toured some theme rooms of other motels in the area. And we still remain fantasy inn faithful!! The rooms are huge and we intend to use that giant tub and open shower!!! You can't get that anywhere else. With rooms large enough to hang out comfortably, and all those fantastic mirrors...go for the gusto, get out of your shell, soak in a heart shaped jacuzzi, walk to the beach.... Just try it once and you will feel like you are going home everytime!!! Thank you fantasy Inn for another wonderful anniversary! See you next year!!
reviews.title: Year 5 and still a satisfied customer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: I love this hotel out of any of the Lake Tahoe hotels. My husband and I are going to be staying there again for our anniversary coming up in October. Every time we stay we are warmly greeted. We have stayed in different rooms every time we go and will continue to stay in a different room. The themes are romantic and fun. My husband and I are a young couple and love the atmosphere of the hotel. I look forward to our stay this upcoming weekend.
reviews.title: Romantic and Fun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This review is for the wedding chapel as I did not stay in the hotel. Carol at the Fantasy Inn & Wedding Chapel was amazing. The garden and chapel are beautiful and the service they provide is highly professional yet friendly and relaxed. I would highly recommend the Fantasy Inn wedding chapel.
reviews.title: Magical Wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed at the Inn four years in a row during our annual tahoe anniversary trips. We started our 1st year staying in Antony and Cleopatra 4 years ago and we have since stayed in caesars indulgence and marie antoinette. As far as cleanliness, I am a registered nurse and a clean hotel is very important!! This hotel has always been very clean. We have always gone through dozens of towels and It seems so strange that there is such a towel shortage when we have always gotten fresh towels without hesitation. We have never experienced a lack of hot water which would make for a miserable stay
reviews.title: My favorite Tahoe hideaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went on June 12, 2012 for our 2nd wedding anniversary. When we returned from dinner, we wanted to use the spa. This is where the problems started. We had no hot water. We called the front desk. We were told, they would check the boiler to make sure it was on, since they had been having problems with it (we were not told this when we checked-in). One hour later, we called again, still no hot water. They said the boiler had been off, it was now on. Just give it more time. The water did finally get warmer after about 1.5hr.
reviews.title: No hot water, and bad service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Next morning, we wanted to take a shower, again no hot water. We called down again (this was the 3rd time we had to call for hot water). Check out was at 11am, it was 10am when we called. No hot water, just a cold shower.
reviews.title: hope the new management take notes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During check-out, we spoke to the front desk person. She tried to tell me the boiler was on-bull.
reviews.title: Not so bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They knew about the problem and didn’t say anything. Then they tried to lie about it when questioned. They gave us $20 dollars off the bill. This is bad business not to mention the possible code violations. We will never go back.
reviews.title: What a dump :(

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nat&Kim
reviews.title: Gross at first glance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wife and I decided to stay here for our anniversary, we stayed in the rain forest super sweet. As we were checking in, the man at the desk (I believe he was the manager) asked if we were going to be using the pay per view, I told him no, he said that good we have been having trouble with the pay perview in that room. Then he told me that they were having trouble with the hot water knor bor the hot tub shutting off, but he thought it was fixed now, when we got to the room, the hot water in the hot tun was running a bit......I went to turn it off, and discovered that the screw was loose, so I used my leatherman and tightened it up, no more trouble there. The toilet would not fush well, and would keep runnin until you went in and jiggled the handle. the smoke alarm was dangling from the ceiling, when the people in the room next door turned on thier water (assuming to fill the hot tub) it was so lound, i could no longer hear the fm radio station that i was listening to (am/fm reciever in the room. There are dual shower heads in the open shower area, they call them his and hers, but when you use them you discover that you need to use both at once to get half of the water pressure that you would get in your shower at home, The manager was a very friendly individual, in fact shortly after we checked out, he called me to let us know that my wife had left her drivers license in the sleeve with the room keys that I had check back in to the front desk. He also told me that the owners were getting ready to put a half a million in upgrades into the proerty, I hope that they make necessary improvments, I would love to stay there after the renovation, to see how it turned out, because the idea is great, the themes of the rooms could be captivating! the ireplace worked well, kept the whole room warm.....but dont run the fireplace and the hot tub at the same time...THE ROOM GETS SUPER HOT!
reviews.title: very out of date, and run down!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed there thinking it would be cute to be in a themed room. The carpet was stained and dirty. The sink kept filling up with water because it was clogged. When we filled up the spa tub, lots of little hairs and dirt particles were floating in the water. It was disgusting. The beds are very uncomfortable and neither of us were able to get any sleep. We also accidentally left my husbands necklace chain that I had bought him for christmas there, but were told they didn't have it. Coincidently, they also couldn't find the negitive comment card we left on the table in the room either. We were told that their housekeepers were very honest and wouldn't take it, and told I must have taken the comment card home with me. We did not take it home. I know it was on the table and that the housekeeper just didn't want to get in trouble for not cleaning the spa tub. We will never return to this dishonest dirty place again. Save your money and your valuables and stay somewhere else.
reviews.title: Dishonest Dirty Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For our 20th aniv. we thought a quick get away to the Fantasy Inn would be fun. We had stayed previously, but after the prices when up, under past ownership, and then with a 2-night min. we did not go back until 2-11-12. Under new ownership, with lower prices and 1-night stay availabilty, we thought we would give it a try.
reviews.title: Read before you stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: These comments are from a general contractors point of view who knows a little about property care & maintenance so when you read the owners reply please note I've been doing this for over 25 years and know a little about workmenship, repair, and pride in ownership of property.
reviews.title: Annual Tradition!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let's start outside and work our way in. The parking lot is about 5 years beyond its life span. The concrete curbs are in bad repair. The sidewalks were replaced with concrete pavers which are cute, but the sand base was not compacted which allowed them to sink. This has d left 1" tall trip hazards at the curbs. That's a libility for the hotel and a safety hazard for guests. The lights over the bed and tub were not working. I was told that I needed to reset the GFCI breaker at the sink for the tub and there as another swith at the door for the lights at the bed. This tells me the switching was installed by someone who thinks its a good idea to cross the room to the front door in the dark before turning on the lights. The hot water valve for the tub leaked so bad I had to place a towel over the nozzle and drape it to the bottom of the tub to not hear the leak. Did I mention the base of the toilet leaked water as well? There's a fun suprise if your not wearing shoes. A towel around the base of it got us to check out time the next morning. Once on the throne you will see the exhaust fan is starting to fall off the ceiling. This fan is only outdone by the exhaust fan for the tub which either did not work or was drastically undersized. The room fills up with so much steam that everything is wet. The A/C helps a little, but is not the solution to this issue. The wet conditions did however bring out a little thing that most guests would not like which we call MOLD! Mold was on the walls of the tub area and in the toilet near the entry door. Gross by most folks standards. There was so much mositure that the painted wall at the tub were pelling and it has been that way for quite some time. The carpet in the halls is stretched so much it is "growing" off the floor. Great if you have skis on, but not attractive to the eye. Upon check out I was told that new owner purchased the place 6 weeks ago and bought a new phone and computer system. I informed the check out clerk that a phone and computer system did not do much for me as a guest. He reluctantly agreed.
reviews.title: Mystic Mountain Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went away for the weekend and decided to have some fun and picked the princess theme room. The staff was great. The room reasonable. The tub amazing. Loved the champagne and strawberries
reviews.title: A little bit of fun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great time, the staff was very friendly and got us everything we needed when we asked for it. The office people we're helpful and friendly. We would recommend this hotel to our friends and family.
reviews.title: Our Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The employees are great! I highly reccomend this hotel, especially during the week. The rates are very reasonable.The service is super!
reviews.title: AWESOME "The staff was great"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: About 18 years ago my husband and I stayed a few different times in your deluxe suites (Roman, Rainforest, Romeo and Juliet). We decided to come to Tahoe for a little getaway yesterday and decided to come back to the Fantasy Inn. We stayed in the Rainforest room and first I have to say your maid service is great nice clean room the check in counter great as well the room not so great. We were both disappointed that the room was really run down. Nothing had changed and by that I mean doesn't look well maintained or updated. The bedding looks old and worn, the mattress has a serious dip in it, cushions on the wicker worn out, no movie channels available, no cream or sugar for you coffee,fan in bathroom broken, the bedding smelled like smoke. We picked the deluxe room to have the nicest room as we did 18 years ago and back then they were amazing rooms. I was so disappointed I didn't want to stay we ended up staying it will be the last time we stay there.I hope that the owners will take a serious look at updating the rooms and bringing them up to the quality that they used to be.
reviews.title: Not going back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although we got the discounted rate of $169 per night for the deluxe suite with whirlpool tub and fireplace, I was still highly disappointed in this hotel. We stayed in the rainforest room and I expected the whimsical decor and mirrored ceilings. I don't think these rooms have been renovated since the 70's and their linens are just as old. I can see not wanting to spend a ton of money on renovations in this economy but they can at least purchase new linens. My pillow was flat as a pancake; the towels were dingy white at best; and the sheets were paper thin. The bathroom soap smelled like Pinesol. Also, note to the management: putting free samples of products in the bathroom is tacky. Needless to say, I won't be staying here again.
reviews.title: Tacky and In Need of Renovation

description: There is just one, very unique Fantasy Inn... an originally designed retreat, refreshing in its simple elegance yet exciting your senses with cleverly designed theme rooms. You won't find it anywhere on earth except here.Built in 1993 across from Lake Tahoe in the heart of the South Lake Tahoe's casino, recreation and skiing core, the inn combines the use of stone, brass, wood and a rustic ambiance with eclectic cupolas and spires like a whimsical palace.And that's just the outside...Inside, 52 rooms, 14 of them one-of-a-kind theme rooms, each present an oversize whirlpool spa and adjacent European shower as its focal point. The mood is definitely romance for two!
